Uses of Class
org.stormdev.authlib.api.StormLogin

  • Packages that use StormLogin 
    Package Description
    org.stormdev.authlib.client  
    org.stormdev.authlib.json.response  

    • Uses of StormLogin in org.stormdev.authlib.client

      Methods in org.stormdev.authlib.client with parameters of type StormLogin 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean StormAuthLib.doActivity(StormLogin login)
      Tell StormDev the login session is active (aka the user is doing things) so that the account isn't logged out automatically for being idle.
      static boolean StormAuthLib.isSessionValid(StormLogin login)
      Used to determine if a StormDev login session is valid and that the user hasn't logged out
      static boolean StormAuthLib.logout(StormLogin login)
      Logout a StormDev login session (Invalidate it)
      static ClientAuthResponse StormAuthLib.sendClientAuth(StormLogin login)
      This is used when a client wants to prove it's genuinely logged into a StormDev login session to a server or other client, but doesn't want to send the sessionID (Because that'd give the other client/server control of the session).

    • Uses of StormLogin in org.stormdev.authlib.json.response

      Methods in org.stormdev.authlib.json.response that return StormLogin 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      StormLogin LoginRequestResponse.toStormLogin()
      Generate a StormLogin object for this session, useful to use with StormAuthLib to easily logout the user later or check if they're still logged in
      StormLogin LoginInfoResponse.toStormLogin()
      Generate a StormLogin object for this session, useful to use with StormAuthLib to easily logout the user later or check if they're still logged in
